ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: There was no TA

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I loved this class...the professors are fantastic. I think was the best class of my semester....especially the discussion part of the class...very engaging and learning experience.
The instructors, the lectures and the discussions were all good, but the lectures were a bit too fast.
the professors and their knowledge and the opportunity to engage them on the readings in the discussion section
The quality of the lecturers
Jim Scott is the most captivating lecturer I've ever had.
The instructors were very knowledgeable in their subject fields and were able to translate that into helping students investigate their interests.

This course is one of Yale's finest offerings in my opinion. The assembly of three top scholars from three distinct but highly interrelated fields and the approach to agrarian issues through a broad but coherent framework are the two highlights of the course.Intimate break out discussions with professors and their willingness to entertain such a broad range of ideas from students in discussion and for final papers was also refreshing and stimulating.
Having multiple professors teaching the course added significantly to the depth and insightfulness of the lectures and discussion sections.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: na
Pace of the lectures. May be 2 sessions per week can improve things
More articles as opposed to just books for out of class readings.
perhaps slightly more balanced geographic approach, if anything.
Providing stronger links between the lectures and reading/discussion.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Lecturers were available and gave quality response. I had contacted Prof Sivaramakrishnan personally with my ideas, and he was very helpful. Prof. James Scott and Prof Peter Perdue were great in responding to doubts.
All three of the instructors were always open to and available for questions.
N/A
The availability and quality of help I received from the professors was exceptional.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It's part of my learning more about anthropological theory (of course the class had a strong historical component as well) to integrate my scientific and legal knowledge to help me formulate the questions I would like to explore during future graduate work.

This course perfectly fits in to my scheme of things. I am planning for environmental anthropology studies in future, and this fits perfect. The course work, readings and lecturers gave me excellent insights in to my future work.
demonstrates value of interdisciplinary yet rigorous workhighly relevant topically

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: The professors
I took this course to supplement/complement my ideas on rural societies, history and thought processes.
To further understand the agrarian societies of the Himalayas I wish to study.
it is a highly valued rite of passage among my colleagues.
The interdisciplinary nature of the course as well as the exceptional professors co-teaching it were the most appealing aspects of the course.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes
To a large extent, yes, it did.
Yes, the professors and material were both amazing.
surpassed them.
The course met and exceeded my expectations.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: yes
Yes
Yes, especially in working on the final term paper.
most certainly.
Not only did I learn what I was expecting, but the course introduced me to a range of theory and debate to which I had previously not been exposed.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: n/a

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Read the books assigned carefully and use the discussion part to explore questions you may be investigating as part of your research

Any student interested in rural, environmental and agrarian research should take this class. James Scott and Sivaramakrishnan are excellent professors who can guide you in to new thoughts. Professor Perdue is a great historian who can place your thoughts in the right place.
utilize the professors and their knowledge for your own interests and field of study.
take advantage of access to all three professors.steer discussion in directions most useful to your area of thinking, yet draw upon diverse strengths assembled.
Be prepared for demanding weekly reading assignments. The course is well worth it.
